div.div:
fix(error_handler): robust Gradio error type check for test compatibility
Refactor Gradio error re-raise logic to ensure isinstance checks only occur when gr.Error is a real exception type, not a mock or None. This prevents TypeError in test environments and improves defensive programming. Also updates tests to expect exceptions instead of fallback values, and uses proper BaseException subclasses for mocks. All tests now pass.
Resolves #51
Signed-off-by: CHEN, CHUN <jim60105@gmail.com>

fix: exit early on missing model IDs and unify downloads
- Add an early exit if version_id or model_id is missing, returning visible updates immediately - Remove the unused msg variable and invoke download_file_thread directly in both branches - Eliminate leftover commented code and an extra return, plus drop a stale “refresh model info” comment
Signed-off-by: CHEN, CHUN <jim60105@gmail.com>

refactor: unify error handling and notification flows
- Remove the error‐handling decorator and the queued‐notification logic from notify_complete, so it only shows UI alerts and logs the result. - Add with_error_handling to download_file_with_notifications so it simply returns success/failure, and move all notify_complete calls into download_file_thread. - In download_file_thread capture the boolean result, invoke notify_complete accordingly, and drop the previous string return. - In the generic with_error_handling decorator, detect and immediately re‐raise gradio.Error before other handlers. - Simplify HTTP client’s authentication handler to always raise AuthenticationError, removing threading‐based branching. - Improve notification service by introducing a logger, replacing print calls with logger methods, catching only ImportError around gradio imports, and streamlining queue processing. - Remove the now‐unused APIError import.
Signed-off-by: CHEN, CHUN <jim60105@gmail.com>

fix: enable error notifications from background threads
- Modified on_download_model_click() to process queued notifications before returning - This ensures error notifications from HTTP operations (background threads) are displayed - Start notifications worked because they're called in Gradio event context - Error notifications failed because they're queued from background threads - Solution: process queued notifications while still in Gradio event context
Resolves the issue where start toasts worked but error toasts didn't appear.
Signed-off-by: CHEN, CHUN <jim60105@gmail.com>

fix(downloader): ensure notifications always output to console
- Add console output for notifications to ensure messages are visible even without a Gradio context, and remove a duplicate notify_start call in the download function. - Removes support for Gradio trigger state variables and simplifies the notification system to print to console if Gradio notification execution fails, ensuring all notifications are visible either in the UI or the console. The handling of queued notifications is updated to always print in case of error and to remove unnecessary indirection with Gradio triggers.
Signed-off-by: CHEN, CHUN <jim60105@gmail.com>

refactor(notification): enable thread-safe queued notifications
- Added logic to process and display any queued notifications from background threads when back in the main thread, including logging the processing or failure to process these queued notifications. - The Gradio notification service was refactored to use a thread-safe, queue-based system for handling notifications, allowing notification methods to be safely invoked from background threads. The class now has support for pending notification history, Gradio state triggers, and a process to explicitly handle queued notifications in the main thread, improving reliability and multi-threaded support.
Signed-off-by: CHEN, CHUN <jim60105@gmail.com>

fix: resolve Gradio error toast not showing issue
- Fixed DownloadNotifier.notify_complete() to use notification service instead of direct gr.Error() calls - The original implementation wrapped gr.Error() in try-except which silently suppressed failures - Now using consistent notification service pattern like notify_start() - Fixed event_handler.py to use notification service for error display - Removed debugging code and fixed linting issues
Resolves the issue where download error toasts were not appearing while success toasts worked properly.
Signed-off-by: CHEN, CHUN <jim60105@gmail.com>

feat(chatmodes): introduce autonomous 4.1 Beast Mode workflow
- Add a new "4.1 Beast Mode" chat mode configuration that instructs the agent to be fully autonomous, iterating thoroughly until all tasks are solved and verified, while following a rigorous multi-step workflow and providing detailed progress updates.
Signed-off-by: CHEN, CHUN <jim60105@gmail.com>

fix(ci): split build matrix to avoid exceeding 256 job limit
Refactor the build matrix in 04-build-matrix-images.yml into two separate jobs (build_matrix_1 and build_matrix_2) to comply with GitHub Actions' 256 job strategy limit. All original image outputs are preserved. This resolves the CI error for exceeding the maximum matrix size. Related to pipeline configuration for #file:04-build-matrix-images.yml.
Signed-off-by: CHEN, CHUN <jim60105@gmail.com>

refactor(http-client): remove Gradio stub for UI decoupling (Phase 3)
Signed-off-by: CHEN, CHUN <jim60105@gmail.com>

fix(http-client): adapt authentication and UI stubs to satisfy Phase 5 tests
* Introduce Gradio UI stub for http_client to support gr.Error and gr.Warning without dependency * Guard UI calls in post_json error handlers and stream errors * Implement thread-aware _handle_authentication_error: abort in main thread, raise AuthenticationError in background threads
Signed-off-by: CHEN, CHUN <jim60105@gmail.com>

test: implement Phase 5 for error handler UI decoupling

Phase 5: Configure silent notification service for tests and add UI decoupling tests for error handling
- Add autouse fixture to set SilentNotificationService, skipping error handler unit tests
- Provide console_notification fixture for tests needing console notifications
- Add tests for error_handler UI decoupling behavior in tests/test_error_handler_ui_decoupling.py
- Adjust error_handler.with_error_handling to properly handle HTTP 524 cases for HTTPError and APIError
- Update http_client UI stubs to support gr.Error and gr.Warning without direct dependency
- Guard gr.Error and gr.Warning in post_json error handlers to avoid NameError - Modify _handle_authentication_error to abort in main thread and raise AuthenticationError in background threads Resolves #51
Signed-off-by: CHEN, CHUN <jim60105@gmail.com>

refactor: consolidate patch contexts for clearer tests
- Refactored tests to consolidate multiple patch contexts into single grouped with statements using parentheses - Added a blank line in test_download_user_gallery_images to separate the import stub from the monkeypatch setup - Improved consistency and readability of patch usage across compatibility, environment detector, and model factory tests
Signed-off-by: CHEN, CHUN <jim60105@gmail.com>

feat(setting,downloader): Phase 4 application-level error handling updates

Phase 4: Application-level error handling updates

- Initialize notification service in setting.init()
- Refactor DownloadNotifier.notify_start to use decorator-based notification
- Add decorated functions download_file_with_auth_handling, download_file_with_retry, download_file_with_file_handling
- Update download_file_with_notifications to utilize new handlers

Signed-off-by: CHEN, CHUN <jim60105@gmail.com>

refactor(http_client): decouple HTTP client errors from UI (Phase 3)
Resolves #51
Signed-off-by: CHEN, CHUN <jim60105@gmail.com>

style(tests): fix flake8 issues in tests
Remove unused imports, fix trailing whitespace, break long import lines to satisfy line-length limit.
Signed-off-by: CHEN, CHUN <jim60105@gmail.com>

fix(notification-service): restore duration support for gr.Error
Revert removal of duration argument for gr.Error to align with updated gradio.Error signature
Signed-off-by: CHEN, CHUN <jim60105@gmail.com>

fix(notification-service): remove unsupported duration argument for gr.Error
This change drops the duration parameter when invoking gr.Error, ensuring that the dummy Error in tests receives only the message and DummyError.last_msg is set correctly. Fixes failing tests in test_error_handler.py.
Signed-off-by: CHEN, CHUN <jim60105@gmail.com>

test(pytest): ignore PendingDeprecationWarning in config
- Add PendingDeprecationWarning to the list of ignored warnings in the pytest configuration.
Signed-off-by: CHEN, CHUN <jim60105@gmail.com>

Revert "refactor(http_client): remove direct Gradio UI calls and decouple HTTP client (Phase 3)"
This reverts commit a9132e672a08fc4e6ccbed8e0229bab274d4b3ac.

refactor(http_client): remove direct Gradio UI calls and decouple HTTP client (Phase 3)
Signed-off-by: CHEN, CHUN <jim60105@gmail.com>

style(exception): wrap long signatures and shorten docstrings
Wrap multi-parameter signatures in exceptions.py to comply with line length limits and shorten long docstrings.
Resolves #51
Signed-off-by: CHEN, CHUN <jim60105@gmail.com>

feat: extend custom exception hierarchy for HTTP client
Extend custom exception hierarchy to include HTTPError, ConnectionError, TimeoutError, DownloadError, and AuthenticationRequiredError in exceptions.py
Resolves #51
Signed-off-by: CHEN, CHUN <jim60105@gmail.com>

refactor: abstract UI notification service and update error handler
Phase 1: Implement UI notification service abstraction and update error handler to use it.\n\nResolves #51.
Signed-off-by: CHEN, CHUN <jim60105@gmail.com>

feat: centralize auth error handling across downloads
- Introduce a new AuthenticationError subclass to represent all authentication-related failures (401/403, login redirects, 416 range errors) - Refactor http_client’s get_stream and response validation to unify 307 redirect and 416 errors under a single authentication handler that raises AuthenticationError when off the main thread - Update downloader logic to catch AuthenticationError explicitly, show a general “configure API key” UI error, and avoid duplicate error messages from the HTTP client - Enhance ParallelImageDownloader to track per-image AuthenticationError instances and surface the first auth error toast after all downloads finish - Change sequential chunked downloads to go through the centralized get_stream path for consistent error treatment - Expand unit tests to cover AuthenticationError in both main and background threads, priority between 416 and 307 handling, and behavior with or without an API key configured
Signed-off-by: CHEN, CHUN <jim60105@gmail.com>

fix(http_client): prevent download of login pages on 307 redirect
- Disable automatic redirects in get_stream method - Add manual redirect handling to detect login pages - Block downloads when redirected to login URLs containing 'login' - Follow valid redirects manually to maintain download functionality - Add comprehensive logging for redirect detection and handling
This prevents corrupted model files when Civitai requires authentication and redirects to login pages instead of the actual file content.
Resolves issue where login HTML was written to .safetensors files.
Signed-off-by: CHEN, CHUN <jim60105@gmail.com>

build(devcontainer): switch to uv sync for environment setup
- Replaced pip install with a uv sync command in the post-create setup and reordered some postCreateCommand entries.
Signed-off-by: CHEN, CHUN <jim60105@gmail.com> (cherry picked from commit 71121e74126bf1e727db0d70a8195449f5d59441)

chore: enable zh_TW.UTF-8 and drop LC_ALL override
- Add a post-create step to enable the zh_TW.UTF-8 locale in the devcontainer - Remove the forced LC_ALL=C environment variable from the container configuration
Signed-off-by: CHEN, CHUN <jim60105@gmail.com> (cherry picked from commit 6e1a17a52abf5f18c90f91fdacc9b8a03ae34614)

build(requirements): remove optional dev dependencies for lean install
- Remove all optional development dependencies from the requirements file.
Signed-off-by: CHEN, CHUN <jim60105@gmail.com> (cherry picked from commit 0f2056111d345550125b1e2d3b0d2f964b88e206)

build(devcontainer): switch to uv sync for environment setup
- Replaced pip install with a uv sync command in the post-create setup and reordered some postCreateCommand entries.
Signed-off-by: CHEN, CHUN <jim60105@gmail.com> (cherry picked from commit 71121e74126bf1e727db0d70a8195449f5d59441)

chore: enable zh_TW.UTF-8 and drop LC_ALL override
- Add a post-create step to enable the zh_TW.UTF-8 locale in the devcontainer - Remove the forced LC_ALL=C environment variable from the container configuration
Signed-off-by: CHEN, CHUN <jim60105@gmail.com> (cherry picked from commit 6e1a17a52abf5f18c90f91fdacc9b8a03ae34614)

build(requirements): remove optional dev dependencies for lean install
- Remove all optional development dependencies from the requirements file.
Signed-off-by: CHEN, CHUN <jim60105@gmail.com> (cherry picked from commit 0f2056111d345550125b1e2d3b0d2f964b88e206)
